Metadata: Cloning of "Vibrio harveyi" chitinase and chitobiase genes in "Escherichia coli"

The abundance of chitin in both the marine and terrestrial environments has led to an interest in developing processes to modify chitin structure and to develop it as a utilizable carbohydrate. Current processes use severe chemical reactions that generate unwanted by-products, eliminate potentially important polymers, and reduce chain length. We describe here a biological approach, namely the construction and isolation of recombinant plasmids that contain the "Vibrio harveyi" structural genes for chitinase, chitobiase, and possibly a permease for chitobiose.
